snippet: The report by Human Rights Watch, based on interviews with 212 victims and witnesses, describes two campaigns of killings and mass rape since early 2014.
abstract: Human Rights Watch reports that Sudan government counterinsurgency unit, known as Rapid Support Forces, is responsible for two campaigns of killings and mass rape carried out in Darfur region in early 2014; area had already been site of mass atrocities by militia groups in mid-2000s.
lead_paragraph: The report by Human Rights Watch, based on interviews with 212 victims and witnesses, describes two campaigns of killings and mass rape since early 2014.

headline.main: Report Details New Atrocities in Darfur by Sudanese Force
headline.print_headline: Study Finds New Atrocities in Darfur

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
